snippet: Lawmakers could tighten the screws on Iran’s leaders in a way that helps produce a nuclear deal. Or they could foul up delicate diplomacy at a crucial moment.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Congress is considering whether to enact severe new sanctions against Iran while world powers prepare for another round of diplomatic talks about nation's nuclear program; threat of sanctions places Congress in role of 'bad cop,' with power to influence negotiations positively or negatively.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers could tighten the screws on Iran’s leaders in a way that helps produce a nuclear deal. Or they could foul up delicate diplomacy at a crucial moment.

headline.main: On Iran Talks, Congress Could Play ‘Bad Cop’
headline.print_headline: On Iran Talks, Congress Could Play ‘Bad Cop’
